Light from the city's buildings reflects off the rippling water, but doesn't cast enough illumination navigate. Only the current, tugging toward the northeast, hints at where you are.

node.name: Iden Araba, East
node.description: Delectable scents from the back of an inn waft over the canal: roasting meat mingles with baking bread and the tang of salt. A squall of gulls swarm near the inn, while on the other side of the canal, a group of pelicans perches on the mooring poles of the outer ring's gondola landing.
Light from the city's buildings reflects off the rippling water, but doesn't cast enough illumination navigate. Only the current, tugging toward the northeast, hints at where you are.
Light from the city's buildings reflects off the rippling water, but doesn't cast enough illumination navigate. Only the current, tugging northward, hints at where you are.

node.name: Iden Araba, East
node.description: Cries of hawkers selling their goods cut through the slosh of water and squawk of birds which normally defines the canal's voice. Small buoys, painted with the colors of their owners, mark the position of lobster traps.
Light from the city's buildings reflects off the rippling water, but doesn't cast enough illumination navigate. Only the current, tugging toward the northeast, hints at where you are.
Light from the city's buildings reflects off the rippling water, but doesn't cast enough illumination to navigate. Only the current, tugging northward, hints at where you are.

node.name: Iden Araba, Northeast
node.description: The Tamris bridge looms nearby, its sculpted ships clearly visible as they sail across the arching sides. Several fishermen have cast their lines over the bridge's side, but, more interested in gossip and coffee, pay little attention to the floats bobbing in the water.
Light from the city's buildings reflects off the rippling water, but doesn't cast enough illumination to navigate. Only the current, tugging toward the northwest, hints at where you are.

node.name: Iden Araba, Northeast
node.description: Blunted by the Tamris bridge's thick footings, the current is slowed as it continues its journey through the canal. Whirls of foamy water spin forward languidly, picking up particles of debris and greenish brown scum torn from the ring foundations.
Light from the city's buildings reflects off the rippling water, but doesn't cast enough illumination to navigate. Only the current, tugging toward the northwest, hints at where you are.

node.name: Iden Araba, North
node.description: Noise from the normal life of the city echoes across the canal. The shallow-walled channel formed by the basalt foundations gathers the sound, echos it and reflects the noise off the water, magnifying its intensity.
Light from the city's buildings reflects off the rippling water, but doesn't cast enough illumination navigate. Only the current, tugging toward the northeast, hints at where you are.
Light from the city's buildings reflects off the rippling water, but doesn't cast enough illumination to navigate. Only the current, tugging toward the northwest, hints at where you are.

node.name: Iden Araba, North
node.description: Crude drawings and crooked-lettered puns scrawled on the bridge's footings emerge through the dark grey paint intended to obscure these rude artistic efforts. The current flows westward toward the sea's entrance to the canal.
The water slapping against the bridge footings echos in the confined space beneath it. A lighter patch of dark marks the mouth of the tunnel.

node.name: Iden Araba, North
node.description: The canal churns with confusion as the westward current shears against the waves pushing through the sea entrance of the outer ring. White froth scuttles across the water's ebb and swell before slapping against the jagged basalt foundation.
Light from the city's buildings reflects off the rippling water, but doesn't cast enough illumination to navigate. Only the current, tugging westward, hints at where you are.

node.name: Iden Araba, Northwest
node.description: Waves rolling in through the sea entrance rake the heavy abutment of the Nelyn Bridge. The angle of the marching waves sets the canal's flow spinning widdershins to the southwest.
Light from the city's buildings reflects off the rippling water, but doesn't cast enough illumination navigate. Only the current, tugging toward the northeast, hints at where you are.
Light from the city's buildings reflects off the rippling water, but doesn't cast enough illumination to navigate. Only the current, tugging to the southwest, hints at where you are.

node.name: Iden Araba, Northwest
node.description: Waves crashing off the jagged foundations of the sea entrance send towering sprays of foam into the air and rippling across the canal's surface. The force of the incoming waves push the canal waters swiftly to the southwest.
Light from the city's buildings reflects off the rippling water, but doesn't cast enough illumination navigate. Only the current, tugging toward the northeast, hints at where you are.
Light from the city's buildings reflects off the rippling water, but doesn't cast enough illumination to navigate. Only the current, tugging toward the southwest, hints at where you are.

node.name: Iden Araba, West
node.description: Dark patches of seagrass growing on the canal bed bend and sway in the current. The canal's strong pull flows southwest past the desolate outer ring and the lively pinks and oranges of the buildings squating on the eyen tayac.
Light from the city's buildings reflects off the rippling water, but doesn't cast enough illumination to navigate. Only the current, tugging toward the southwest, hints at where you are.

node.name: Iden Araba, West
node.description: Swept by the strong southward current, clumps of grey moss cling precariously to the smooth, finished foundation wall of the middle ring. Colonies of tiny blue snails coat both canal walls like textured, sky-speckled paint.
Light from the city's buildings reflects off the rippling water, but doesn't cast enough illumination to navigate. Only the current, tugging southward, hints at where you are.

node.name: Iden Araba, West
node.description: Cries from the middle ring, perhaps the theater barker hawking tickets or a flock of dissatisfied gulls, float across the water. The current swirls southward, dragging strings of foam with it.
Light from the city's buildings reflects off the rippling water, but doesn't cast enough illumination to navigate. Only the current, tugging southward, hints at where you are.

node.name: Iden Araba, Southwest
node.description: The canal's waters flow past the gulls diving for scraps thrown off the roadway above, then duck beneath the starfish sculpted on the Zirelga bridge's arches high overhead. The current rolls between the massive stone footings toward the southeast.
Light from the city's buildings reflects off the rippling water, but doesn't cast enough illumination to navigate. Only the current, tugging toward the southeast, hints at where you are.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Gull Circle
node.description: Unless hidden behind the miscellaneous construction tools or stacks of cobblestones, there are no laborers working on the ring. The deep gouges scarring the edge of the road may have something to do with this, as they are obviously not the result of any shovel or hammer.

node.name: Eyen Araba, Southeast
node.description: Stringy swags of moss hang from underside of the Dajere Bridge. A tangle of debris is pushed against the bridge's footing, pinned in place by the inward rushing current.
The water slapping against the bridge footings echos in the confined space beneath it. A lighter patch of dark marks the mouth of the tunnel.

node.name: Eyen Araba, South
node.description: The current quickens as the water is pulled by the water surging through the canal gates further northeast. Overhead, gulls swoop from the Dajere Bridge, dive at the water below, then return to their perches.
Light from the city's buildings reflects off the rippling water, but doesn't cast enough illumination to navigate. Only the current, tugging eastward, hints at where you are.

node.name: Eyen Araba, South
node.description: Streaks of white brine stain the foundation's surface. Moving sluggishly, the water can't quite clean the reeking pools of refuse that collect in the crevices of the rock footings.
Light from the city's buildings reflects off the rippling water, but doesn't cast enough illumination to navigate. Only the current, tugging eastward, hints at where you are.

node.name: Eyen Araba, East
node.description: Wakes from passing barges and gondolas churn the canal's surface. The current, propelled by the influx of water from the outer canal, surges toward the northeast.
Light from the city's buildings reflects off the rippling water, but doesn't cast enough illumination to navigate. Only the current, tugging toward the northeast, hints at where you are.

node.name: Eyen Araba, East
node.description: The gondola slips moored at the museum deflect the strong current toward the eyen tayac -- the inner ring. Crashing against the city's jagged basalt roots, the current dissipates as lurches northward.
Light from the city's buildings reflects off the rippling water, but doesn't cast enough illumination to navigate. Only the current, tugging northward, hints at where you are.

node.name: Eyen Araba, East
node.description: Sudsy white flecks float northward in the current. They coalesce, forming patches of bubbly film, only to be dashed against the jagged foundation rocks and rendered once again into small foamy blotches.
Light from the city's buildings reflects off the rippling water, but doesn't cast enough illumination to navigate. Only the current, tugging northward, hints at where you are.

node.name: Eyen Araba, Northeast
node.description: Whirling eddies of water spin around the footings of the Tamris Bridge. The slap of water on rock kicks up a frothy spray.
The water slapping against the bridge footings echos in the confined space beneath it. A lighter patch of dark marks the mouth of the tunnel.

node.name: Eyen Araba, North
node.description: Barely visible, a bed of purplish-green seaspike grows in uneven patches on the bottom of the canal. Their pointy fronds ripple in the current.
Light from the city's buildings reflects off the rippling water, but doesn't cast enough illumination to navigate. Only the current, tugging toward the northwest, hints at where you are.

node.name: Eyen Araba, North
node.description: Cobri Esheceni! is scrawled across on the bridge's footing above the high tide mark -- possibly a reference to the many caravans that use the roadway above, but is more likely commentary about the denizens of Town Hall which sits across from the bridge's entrance.
The water slapping against the bridge footings echos in the confined space beneath it. A lighter patch of dark marks the mouth of the tunnel.

node.name: Eyen Araba, North
node.description: The swift southwest current funnels against the steep foundation of the Tuilis Clemois and central platform. A slick layer of algae coats the underpinnings of the ring: what looks like an easy climb is a treacherous reality.
Light from the city's buildings reflects off the rippling water, but doesn't cast enough illumination to navigate. Only the current, tugging westward, hints at where you are.

node.name: Eyen Araba, Northwest
node.description: Half-raveled and rotted, a fishing net hangs from a twisted bit of metal wedged into the stone masonry of the Nelyn Bridge. The bottom of the net flops onto a small rock shelf near one of the bridge's footings.
The water slapping against the bridge footings echos in the confined space beneath it. A lighter patch of dark marks the mouth of the tunnel.

node.name: Eyen Araba, West
node.description: Bearing south, the current rushes between the central platform -- what the Rissans call mercen dirailur -- and the inner ring. Bright spots of paper, origami ships, bob in the water.
Light from the city's buildings reflects off the rippling water, but doesn't cast enough illumination to navigate. Only the current, tugging toward the southwest, hints at where you are.

node.name: Eyen Araba, West
node.description: The current swirls past the western gondola landing on the central platform and, slowed by the bulk of the slips, wends toward the Zirelga Bridge. Rivulets of slimy moss coat the walls containing the canal.
Light from the city's buildings reflects off the rippling water, but doesn't cast enough illumination to navigate. Only the current, tugging southward, hints at where you are.

node.name: Eyen Araba, West
node.description: The aroma of roasting meat and bread baking from the restaurants in the theater district overlays the pungent odor of salt and decaying waste. Moving lazily, the current flows southward.
Light from the city's buildings reflects off the rippling water, but doesn't cast enough illumination to navigate. Only the current, tugging southward, hints at where you are.

node.name: Eyen Araba, Southwest
node.description: A splotchy layer of moss and pearlescent blue shellfish coats the bridge footings between high and low tide. Fresh striations in the rock mark where someone has harvested some of the clinging mussels.
The water slapping against the bridge footings echos in the confined space beneath it. A lighter patch of dark marks the mouth of the tunnel.

node.name: Eyen Araba, South
node.description: Slowed by the gondola landing, the torpid water struggles eastward. A small pile of driftwood floats against one of the gondola slips.
Light from the city's buildings reflects off the rippling water, but doesn't cast enough illumination to navigate. Only the current, tugging toward the southeast, hints at where you are.

node.name: Crescent Gardens, Memorial Arch
node.description: A set of stone steps rises upwards into the terraced lawns, flanked by the waving stalks of cultivated orchids and lilies. Opposite, a white-washed arch leads out to the street, twisted rose vines entangling themselves lovingly within the gaps of the arch's trelliswork. Even at such a short distance, the sounds of the busy road begin to fade, absorbed by the flora as a sponge absorbs water.

node.name: Crescent Gardens, Terraced Lawn
node.description: Brilliant orchids dance along the edges of raised terraces, performers on natural stages that would make many a landscaper proud. Each morning, the tiny flowers unfold to catch any breeze and sway in their dance, while each night they fold slowly and graciously for slumber. The scene is repeated on many of the planted terraces about the lawn by a multitude of different plants, some brightly colored, others simply green.

node.name: Crescent Gardens, Terraced Lawn
node.description: The potent scent of brine mingles with fragrant orchids in an exotic combination, whipped by the coastal winds that swirl up from the waters of Torbis Sanhalas Bay and over the terraced slopes of the lawn. Adding to the white of the heady flowers are silk memorial ribbons, tied at intermittent heights in the trees and shrubs and shuddering slightly in the sea breezes.

node.name: Crescent Gardens, Patio Entrance
node.description: The curving walls of a one-story building embrace the lawns, the building itself closely surrounded by the lush gardens. A few audacious vines crawl upwards, reaching vainly for the eaves. Centered in the side of the concave structure is a mahogany door, adorned with a solemn assortment of white ribbons and a few bows. Above the door a wreath hangs, the visible symbol of a loss.

node.name: Crescent Gardens, Terraced Lawn
node.description: Pale and unobtrusive, a portrait of a demurely smiling Elven woman nestles snugly against the walls of foliage. At the foot of the stand it rests upon, flowers lie, and fluttering in the trees all around are white ribbons. A glimpse of pink winks from behind the painting -- not a flower, but the side of Torbis Sanhalas Hospital next door.

node.name: Mer'Kresh Empathic Gathering Hall, Front Passage
node.description: Simplistic in design and function, the foyer serves as both a reception area and main hall, curving off in either direction. At the apex of the curve, a multi-paneled door resides in the wall, etched with an unusual pattern and guarded by a birch-topped desk. A white banner stretches over the door, and small bows and wreaths hang from the ceiling rafters.

node.name: Mer'Kresh Empathic Gathering Hall, Study Area
node.description: Shelves line all but one of the walls, each filled with books, memorabilia, and assorted odds and ends. A large picture window takes up the space of the remaining wall, revealing a sharp slope cluttered with orchids and day-lilies, some of which droop as if in mourning against the backdrop of the bay's waters. The shore of M'Riss lies far beyond, details lost to distance.

node.name: Mer'Kresh Empathic Gathering Hall, Student Walk
node.description: A double row of bricks runs down the base of the corridor, butting tight against the exposed support timbers. Diagrams and pictorial sequences of healing in process do a poor job hiding the unfinished walls, the parchment curling up in the miniscule breezes set into motion by passing students. Abruptly, the papers and the hall stop, the rough timbers replaced with the smooth handrails of an open-air walkway leading to a pink structure next door.

node.name: Torbis Sanhalas Hospital, Open Air Walkway
node.description: Two ship's masts stretch between the hospital and the crescent-shaped Empath's hall, lodged firmly in the walls of each. A sturdy walkway connects the two buildings with the mast's firm support as the pink walls of the hospital stare beneath at the slope dropping away from the Empath's hall. Those areas of the horizon that aren't blocked by the dual structures exposes Mer'Kresh in all its splendor as well as the far shores of M'Riss.

node.name: Torbis Sanhalas Hospital, Balcony
node.description: If only for show, a thin wooden arch marks the point at which the balcony cuts into a tight angle and then changes into an open-air walkway. The far side of the walkway collides into one wall of a pale crescent-shaped building. A simple wooden plaque gazes across as a few dried rose petals swirl in the air beneath it.

node.name: Torbis Sanhalas Hospital, Balcony
node.description: The balcony curves around the street-facing side of the hospital, hugging tight to its arching pink surface, while the large windows that surround the hospital's domed top loom overhead, too high to reveal a sight of the interior. Mer'Kresh is not difficult to see, as this lofty vantage turns the streets and roads into ripples on the surface of a puddle, radiating outwards from the Carillion at the center of town.

node.name: Torbis Sanhalas Hospital, Bay Overlook
node.description: Far across the waters lies the coast, dotted with buildings and dwellings along the Ring Road. Angling towards that shore is the aqueduct, a marvel of engineering that provides fresh water for the city. A glance eastwards bestows a more natural scene of the far-off lands of M'Riss, while below, the waters of the bay for which the hospital is named lap against the stony rocks of the shore.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Zirelga Bridge
node.description: The cobblestones on the bridge are all painted gaily in brilliant shades of pink and orange and create a starfish arrangement, marred only be the streaks from wheelbarrows and carts. Respite from the crowds of the inner rings is found here since few people venture too far across Zirelga Bridge on a regular basis, preferring to use only the northeastern tip to circumvent the thickest of gatherings.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Zirelga Bridge
node.description: One wall of a tavern on Pearl Circle leans snugly against the supports of the bridge, but its mottled blue roof tiles are out of reach to all but the seagulls. Here, at the highest point in the arch of the bridge, the skyline opens wide to reveal all the intricacies of the architecture of Mer'Kresh and the way it weaves into one panoramic scene of city life.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Zirelga Bridge
node.description: The bridge stops suddenly, jutting out and above the unfinished surface of Gull Circle. The overpowering scent of garbage and refuse drifts from below, while a wooden sign on the bridge's railing directs workers to be cautious in their tasks. White feathers along the edge reveal the attraction the smell has had for seagulls, even though none currently dine on the scraps that swirl in the breeze.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Pearl Circle
node.description: A squat, dark tunnel bored through the footings of the massive Zirelga Bridge connects the southern quadrant of Pearl Circle to the western quarter. Barely big enough to allow two merchant wagons to pass side by side, those afoot must take care to avoid being crushed. Oil lamps held high by heavy metal sconces illuminate the moss growing on the ceiling, and the trickle of moisture that perpetually dampens the walls.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Pearl Circle
node.description: The arc of the road sweeps west toward a cluster of buildings shouldering against the Zirelga Bridge. Narrow wrought iron balconies and window boxes bright with flowers adorn the shopkeepers' homes built above their businesses. In a bay window of one shop, a succession of young women models clothing. They pose and turn, then smile at the crowds gathered to watch, enticing their audience to buy.

The arc of the road sweeps west toward a cluster of buildings shouldering against the Zirelga Bridge. Narrow wrought iron balconies and window boxes bright with flowers adorn the shopkeepers' homes built above their businesses. The bay window of one shop, usually the stage for young women to display clothing, is dark with the curtains partially drawn. A chink of candle light from one corner of the shop casts wavering shadows upon the mannequins clad in the fashions for tomorrow's models.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Pearl Circle
node.description: Trays of chocolates and strands of spun sugar are prominently displayed in one of the shop windows. A group of noisy children lean against the panes, their fingers and noses smudging the glass as they peer longingly at the sweets and plan their purchases. The cobbled road curves west toward the Zirelga Bridge and away from the sparsely populated southern quadrant of Pearl Circle.

Waxed paper covers the trays of chocolates, dishes of gumdrops and bowls of marzipan prominently displayed in one of the shop windows. A dim light filtering from the back of the store reveals the shopkeeper inside, busily scraping fudge on a marble tabletop in preparation of the next day's business. The cobbled road curves west toward the Zirelga Bridge and away from the sparsely populated southern quadrant of Pearl Circle.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Pearl Circle
node.description: A shabby gondola landing spans the width of the ring. Tacked above a small shack, a sign proclaims "Rent Here" in paint so badly flaked as to be nearly illegible. Northward, a set of wobbly steps creaks down to the gondolas docked in the inner canal. Across the street, a stairway southward descends to a half-sunken dock where boats tie up in the outer canal.

The dim light from the street torches flicker off the canal waves. A shabby gondola landing spanning the width of the ring draws a fair business from couples desiring a romantic evening boat ride. Rent Here proclaims a sign, with paint so badly flaked as to be nearly illegible. Northward, a set of wobbly steps creaks down to the gondolas docked in the inner canal. Across the street, a stairway southward descends to a half-sunken dock where boats tie up in the outer canal.

A shabby gondola landing spans the width of the ring. Tacked above a small shack, a sign proclaims Rent Here in paint so badly flaked as to be nearly illegible. Northward, a set of wobbly steps creaks down to the gondolas docked in the inner canal. Across the street, a stairway southward descends to a half-sunken dock where boats tie up in the outer canal.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Pearl Circle
node.description: Tufts of wiry brown grass push up through the cobbles, and flowering weeds edging the roadside gutters wave in the gentle breeze flowing from the outer canal. Rubble litters one side of the road, debris from a section of buildings torn down to make way for fresh construction. Across the street, sparkling new paint and crisp curtains adorn MAMAS, the local assay shop.

Tufts of wiry brown grass push up through the cobbles, and flowering weeds edging the roadside gutters wave in the gentle breeze flowing from the outer canal. Several shadowy figures pick through the rubble littering one side of the road, no doubt salvaging items left in the pile created when some buildings were torn down to make way for fresh construction. Across the street, sparkling new paint and crisp curtains adorn MAMAS, the local assay shop.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Pearl Circle
node.description: Fewer buildings jam the roadway as the cracked cobbles curve toward the end of the circle where the middle and inner canals meet. The yards grow from tiny to small, and some homes have little lawns carpeted with neatly trimmed grass. An old store, shaded by faded blue and green striped awnings at the windows, sags toward a young oak tree whose roots have found purchase deep in the alluvial soil beneath the city.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Pearl Circle
node.description: Night has silenced the raucous squawking, barks, growls and braying that normally screeches forth from the pet shop. The parrots in the store window have their heads tucked beneath their vibrantly plumed wings, and the small furry animals are curled into slumbering balls. Northeast toward the end of the ring, where few people travel or care, the cobbles gradually become loose and rutted.

Raucous squawking accompanied by various barks, growls and braying screech forth from a small wooden building. The store window is full of vibrantly plumed parrots clinging to their perches as they bob their heads in time to the noise, and small furry animals peep out of their cages at passersby. East toward the end of the ring, where few people travel or care, the cobbles gradually become loose and rutted.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Pearl Circle
node.description: Piles of cracked basalt mark one tip of Pearl Circle's foundation. The Dajere Bridge deflects the waves in the channel toward the edges of the circle and sends the water sloshing forcefully against the ring's dark stone bed. Several benches and picnic tables set near the water offer a panoramic view of the inner platform, the bridge, and the turbulent water where the canals meet. Savory aromas waft from a modest wooden building nearby.

Shadows from the street torches streak the nearby Dajere Bridge and canals. The waves striking the ring's stone foundation seem loud without the normal noises of day, and the night breeze off the canal is brisk with cold and brine. Savory aromas waft from a modest wooden building nearby.

node.name: Carillon, Bell Tower
node.description: Eight bronze bells are suspended from the carillon's rafters. Each bell is a different size, and each plays a different scale note. A series of arched openings cut through the walls allow the sea breeze to flow in and the toll of the bells to ring out.

node.name: Harti Clemois Bank, Lobby
node.description: The bank lobby has been roofed over and is open to customers, although the walls still show some scorching where the painters have not yet finished. Scaffolding and building supplies lie here and there. The staircase to the second floor, uncarpeted as yet, has been repaired and the polished wooden handrail replaced.

node.name: Harti Clemois Bank, Main Hallway
node.description: Stately guardians, two potted fiddlehead ferns of enormous size flank the staircase leading to the lobby below. Obviously, some extraordinary measures were taken to promote the growth of these two decorations, be it magic or alchemical, perhaps for the purpose of drawing attention from the doors beyond. An ash door peeks out from the behind the fern to the north and down the hall towards its ornate looking opposite. The hall itself opens to a domed courtyard filled with a multitude of plants.

node.name: Harti Clemois Bank, Courtyard
node.description: A dazzling array of multicolored plants with large, floppy leaves decorates every niche and recess of the walls. Most of the plants have been set into heavy looking ceramic pots and all show signs of good maintenance. A deep red carpet stretches across the floor, marking pathways through the flora and along the gently inclined stairs leading upwards.

node.name: Harti Clemois Bank, Courtyard
node.description: There is a definitive lack of the larger indoor plants that make up the decor in other parts of the bank's courtyard. Where they might have been, large statues of crouching gargoyles sit. Despite the tell-tale worn spots in the center of the red carpet, little business takes place here beneath the eyes of the grotesque stone forms.

node.name: Harti Clemois Bank, Courtyard
node.description: The timid beige hues of the walls peek out from behind the brilliant splash of the red and green foliage of the potted plants. Pushed against one of the polished stone walls is a wooden bench padded with red velvet. The indentations in the seat confirm that many a trader and bank employee have rested here, stopping to gaze upwards at the soft glow of daylight from the domed ceiling above.

node.name: Harti Clemois Bank, Conference Room 'X'
node.description: Unadorned tapestries hang from a handful of thick bronze wall mounts encircling the room, doing little but adding to the already present gloom. The tapestries have been arranged in such a way that they emphasize the solid oak table set centrally. Without a skylight or window to shed any illumination upon the table, items upon it take on a similar murky quality.

node.name: Harti Clemois Bank, Teller's Window
node.description: A pretty Elf sits behind the teller's window, dabbing occasionally at the rose petal makeup daintly applied to her cheeks. Every so often she looks towards the exit and past the velvet ropes that file customers to her booth and sighs. A soft light flows in from the courtyard outside, as well as from the skylight above, keeping the area cheerfully lit for the benefit of easy transactions.

A tired-looking Halfling sits behind the teller's window, grumbling as he occasionally drops a handful of coins. Every so often he begins to nod off in front of a customer, snapping awake only after a few seconds elapse. The dark sky stares down through the skylight above, lending no helpful light to the fumbling teller.

node.name: Harti Clemois Bank, Moneychanger
node.description: Appearing to be little more than an afterthought in the construction of the bank, the coin exchanger's room is manned by a stooped, elderly Human. He constantly kneads something at his chest as he sits behind the safety of the steel bars that seperate him from his customers. The black metal and ironwood craftwork of the booth is in direct opposition to the softer hues and flowing architecture of the beige stonework elsewhere in the bank.

node.name: Harti Clemois Bank, Conference Room 'B'
node.description: More cramped than cozy, this conference room has seen a fair amount of use. The carpet has lost its color in an arching trail from the ash door to the chair at the head of the glossy black table, and the walls are brown from years of cigar-smoking inhabitants.

node.name: Origami Shop
node.description: Burlap bags filled with old rags cast a sharp scent throughout the shop. Several fine mesh screens lean against a large square tub filled with thick, grey liquid. Colorfully glazed jars, brushes, and sheets of raw paper are neatly arranged on the work table in the center of the room. Above, finished paper is hanging to dry on rough cord strung from wall to wall.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Santazel's Lean-To
node.description: Splits of leather, replacement hilts and blades, rivets and metal scraps are jumbled together in crates. A box of broken shields, armor and weapons sits in one relatively clean corner. Two barrels with a plank of wood across them serve as a makeshift counter. In the back of the small lean-to, a scruffy-looking Elf with tobacco-stained teeth and fingers works at his trade.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Entrance
node.description: Tall and stately, the entrance to the guild proper looms just ahead. Giant slabs of quarried stone support a gabled entrance which frames a door of immense proportions. From this vantage point, both the hushed tones of conversation and the clanging of metal on metal can be heard.

Tall and stately, the entrance to the guild proper looms just ahead. Giant slabs of quarried stone support a gabled entrance which frames a door of immense proportions. As long shadows cast their quiet presence on the arched porticos, a sense of peace and tranquility settles over the darkened building.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Grand Hall
node.description: A magnificent room of great breadth and height is set off by smooth alabaster walls and tall arched windows that suffuse the hall with sunlight. A huge stone fireplace commands the entire north wall with several large chairs placed strategically to take advantage of the warmth of the roaring fire. Footfalls are subdued by several skin throws on the cold stone floor.

A magnificent room of great breadth and height is set off by smooth alabaster walls and tall arched windows that suffuse the hall with moonlight. A huge stone fireplace commands the entire north wall with several large chairs placed strategically to take advantage of the warmth of the roaring fire. Footfalls are subdued by several skin throws on the cold stone floor.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Armory
node.description: A beautifully carved display case fills most of one side of this narrow room. Razor-sharp blades atop the case glint with reflected light, emphasizing their flawless condition. Shields of all types hang closely together along the opposite wall, many bearing the crest of the Paladin guild or the D'Sel family.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Portico
node.description: In contrast with the otherwise stark architecture, the portico is softened by latticework and silvery vines. An open window offers a glimpse of fresh cut flowers and the unmistakable smell of roasting meat. A dirt path leads toward the east and the training fields.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Courtyard
node.description: Cobbled stones are precisely set into a swirling pattern around a central garden. A large iron gate separates the courtyard from a shaded portico that leads back toward the living quarters. Sounds of music, laughter and the clinking of metal on metal accompanies the bustle of activity outside this otherwise peaceful enclave.

Cobbled stones are precisely set into a swirling pattern around a central garden. A large iron gate separates the courtyard from a shaded portico that leads back toward the living quarters. Sounds of soft music, and quiet laughter punctuate this otherwise peaceful enclave.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Hallway
node.description: At the top of the steps, the noise from the courtyard lessens and can only faintly be heard. The cobblestone steps end at marble flooring. A large ornamental rug, which almost encompasses the entire hall, lies in the middle of the floor. This passageway does not have the look of a room with heavy traffic as dust has built up on several of the surfaces. Several benches and chairs are scattered throughout the hall as if it were a waiting area. A lone door sits in the far northwest corner.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Training Field
node.description: High wooden walls surround the expansive training field. On the opposite side of the field, a massive gate that opens to the street is barred with an equally massive wooden beam. Several younger paladins attend their training sessions here, eager eyes focused on one grizzled tutor as he demonstrates combat stances with grace and agility.

High wooden walls cast oppressive shadows across the vast training field. Darkened by nightfall, the short clipped grasses gather fresh dew and prepare for the dawn of a new day. The clinking of metal on metal is now just a memory invading many a young squire's dream.

node.name: Paladins' Guild, Lady Avant's Office
node.description: A long room, appointed with dark hardwood mouldings and a beautiful woven carpet, the office exudes a quiet sensibilty. A massive cherrywood desk commands the far end of the room, the long walk agonizing to any young squire summoned to speak with the Guild Mistress. In each corner of the office, a large iron stand supports a fat, scented candle nestled among silver ivy vines.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, The Carousel
node.description: Exotic tapestries of every possible description drape the wall ringing the Carousel's core. A circular roof supports a vast framework of iron and timbers rising to the building's apex. Countless gears, pulleys and weights within the structure form the strikingly complex and beautiful mechanism which drives the Carousel.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Carousel Booth
node.description: A polished steel lever protrudes from the eastern wall of the small, ebony-panelled room, flanking a steel door to the north.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Carousel Booth
node.description: A polished steel lever protrudes from the eastern wall of the small, ebony-panelled room, flanking a steel door to the north.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Carousel Chamber
node.description: A sturdy vault, set in the back wall, stands ready for your use. The floor is covered by a soft thick carpet of deep red, and the walls are paneled in polished gold pine. Looking at the back wall, you notice a tiny gap between it and the rest of the room.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Carousel Booth
node.description: A polished steel lever protrudes from the eastern wall of the small, ebony-panelled room, flanking a steel door to the north.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Carousel Booth
node.description: A polished steel lever protrudes from the eastern wall of the small, ebony-panelled room, flanking a steel door to the north.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Carousel Desk
node.description: A long wooden desk spans the width of the western wall. Brass lanterns hang from the ceiling, and the floor behind the desk is covered in spotless red tile.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Carousel Chamber
node.description: A sturdy vault, set in the back wall, stands ready for your use. The floor is covered by a soft thick carpet of deep red, and the walls are paneled in polished gold pine. Looking at the back wall, you notice a tiny gap between it and the rest of the room.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Carousel Chamber
node.description: A sturdy vault, set in the back wall, stands ready for your use. The floor is covered by a soft thick carpet of deep red, and the walls are paneled in polished gold pine. Looking at the back wall, you notice a tiny gap between it and the rest of the room.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Carousel Chamber
node.description: A sturdy vault, set in the back wall, stands ready for your use. The floor is covered by a soft thick carpet of deep red, and the walls are paneled in polished gold pine. Looking at the back wall, you notice a tiny gap between it and the rest of the room.

node.name: Globe Arena, Entryway
node.description: A stone relief of a young barbarian dressed in fur-lined leather straddles the door. Several raging polar bears circle the young lad, their snarls etched with meticulous care. Behind, a tremendous fortress rises from a snowy plain and blocks some of the mountains that line the horizon.

node.name: Globe Arena, Barbarian's Hall
node.description: Two large basalt statues lean forward from the wall, flanking a simple oak podium. Both of the stone forms are identical, and each statue's face is curled in a cross between a snarl and a grin that bears rows of flat, square teeth. Nestled on the wall between the two is a portrait of a young barbarian holding a gleaming broadsword aloft in triumph.

node.name: Globe Arena, Side Hall
node.description: Textured stone lines the walls between the massive columns supporting the roof. A fresco of a straining barbarian, struggling to drag a giant-sized catapult across the burning sands of a desert, stretches across the wall. On one side of the barbarian, a horde of jeering Gorbesh soldiers screams. On the other side, a small group of wounded warriors cluster, pinned down by Gorbesh arrows while they await the heroic barbarian's salvation.

node.name: Globe Arena, South Hall
node.description: Along the southern wall, a remarkable frieze depicts an exploding volcano flinging blazing orbs into the bay. Several boats are lashed together in the water, just out of reach of most of the fiery lava chunks, and a wall of stoic-looking barbarians, with weapons drawn, deflect those few projectiles that threaten the vessels. Clearly, some liberties were taken by the sculptor.

node.name: Globe Arena, The Pit
node.description: Four large statues bear the weight of the domed ceiling upon their shoulders, each at the corner of an area cleared of obstructions. A thick length of rope encircles the area, affixed tightly to the floor to cordon off a sparring section, and to mark a boundary for contests of skill. Clearly known as The Pit for esoteric reasons, there is actually nothing here that resembles a pit or sunken area.

node.name: Globe Arena, Upper Hallway
node.description: More a landing than a true hallway, there is little in this tiny alcove at the top of the stairs except a reed mat on the floor and heavy cypress door. Even the whitewashed walls are bare of everything but a few fingerprints.

node.name: Globe Arena, Roaring Room
node.description: Deep swaths of quilted white fabric covering the ceiling and walls give the impression of huge pillows stuck to the interior surfaces. Underfoot, a thick brown carpet muffles the sound of movement. Even the window is made of several layers of glass set into the frame. Amidst this stark decor, a lone table huddles near the door.

node.name: Globe Arena, Courtyard
node.description: White sand embedded with chunks of black volcanic rock covers the ground like soot-streaked snow. Raised beds of esturi fruit bound one side of the courtyard, and figs grow in the bed opposite. An obsidian fountain sits in the center of the area erupting not with a geyser of water, but one of flame.

node.name: Globe Arena, Library
node.description: Slate stepping stones are harmoniously laid to create a winding path through the neatly raked sand floor. Reed mats offer a place to sit and study -- or lie and snooze. Books are neatly arranged on a bookcase resting atop a large, flat-surfaced rock serving as a desk.

node.name: Globe Arena, Guest Quarters
node.description: Twists of morning glory cling to the bamboo arch, nearly obscuring it in a green shadow, and a stone threshold separates the courtyard's sand from the neatly clipped common yard where these homes rest. Each bamboo hut's exterior is nearly identical to its neighbor, giving a serene and ordered look to the small neighborhood.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Under the Aether Dome
node.note: Warrior Mage|GL Warrior Mage|Margathe|RS Warrior Mage
node.description: Thick cut-looped carpets cover the floor and a circle of cushions scattered around the water pipe provide a place to talk and watch the aquarium fish. A tile walkway edges the walls, allowing passage through the area without leaving boot-dirt on the rugs. One corner holds the guild leader's desk and a set of bookshelves. The great dome of the guild looms overhead, its interior decorated with a flowery lattice-work in gold leaf and azure.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Hall of Air
node.description: Several knotted hangings, each worked in the shape of an animal, are tacked to the walls. Cushions and crumbs surround a low rosewood table that matches the corner bookshelf. The hardwood floor is uncarpeted and unremarkable, except for a splattering of green paint near the stair.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Hall of Earth
node.description: Triangular raised planting beds are set in a rough triskele with smooth ocean pebbles and crushed shell providing a walkway through the garden. A potting table rests against one wall, with a large wheelbarrow of loam parked next to it. Skylights in the dome above ensure enough light for healthy plants. The aroma of floral and herbal fragrances has banished the scent of brimstone and naphtha, leaving this as the only room in the guild that doesn't smell of something burning.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Hall of Water
node.description: Dark tiled walkways surround a shallow octagonal pool with a fountain set in its center. The pool's blue and green tiles create an intricate, repetitive geometric mosaic that gives the impression of looking through a kaleidoscope. The fountain's water trickles into the pool with a lulling patter. A cypress bench rests against one wall, with a cluster of potted palms on either side.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Hall of Fire
node.description: Tattered bits of burned carpet have been pulled together to cover the floor at one end of the hall. Scorched chairs and singed tables are clustered near the carpet. The other end of the hall is starkly empty, the walls burned and gouged and the floor coated with ash.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Tower of Air
node.description: Airy and open, the landing's archways give a clear southeasterly view beyond the inner canal to the break in the middle ring and the Dajere Bridge. An occasional murmur from people passing below rises up the stairwell to mix with the sounds of the canal and Screeee! of the gulls. Each quadrant of the dome's ceiling is painted with a view of the sky.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Tower of Fire
node.description: Airy and open, the landing's archways give a clear view over the city toward the carillon, and of the northern end of the Dajere Bridge. Smoke and noise drift up from below, accompanied by the smell of naptha, brimstone, and incense. Every so often, the conversations of people below can be heard over the racket and rumpus downstairs. Despite regular cleanings, the dome overhead is covered with a sooty film that obscures the decoration.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Tower of Earth
node.description: Airy and open, the landing's archways give a clear northwesterly view over the city and toward the carillon. The smell of cultivated earth and growing plants wafts up from below, and partially obscures the ever-present scent of something burning. The dome was designed with skylights to provide plenty of sun for the plants.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Tower of Water
node.description: Airy and open, the landing's archways give a clear northeasterly view beyond the inner canal to the colorful homes and businesses nestled on the middle ring. The sound of splashing water rising from the fountain mingles with the slosh of the canal to drown out any conversation from the lower room. The dome is painted in blues and greens, its geometric motif a mirror of the pattern in the pool below.

node.name: Ship Circle, Scupper's Furrier
node.description: Neat as a pin, Scupper's Furrier Shop still bears the disquieting scent of uncured hides and pelts. An attempt has been made to mask it, not quite successfully, with large bowls of potpourri placed here and there. Scupper busies himself about the place, moving stock from one pile to another.

node.name: Oweede's Place
node.description: The air is thick with motes of dust dancing in the dim light and the scent of lemon polish nearly masks the smell of musk. Heavy oak shelves lining the walls from floor to ceiling bow under the weight of countless items of undeterminable value. A stack of crates holding hundreds of used cards and wedding invitations rests against the end of a scarred counter. In one corner, a canvas sack full of dull jelly beans lies against a box overflowing with used shapers.

node.name: Library, Foyer
node.description: Two sculptures, each resting upon a slender pedestal, flank the archway leading into the main reading room. A mural depicting M'Riss flows across the walls. Each wave, each gull, each pinnacle of rock is so exacting in detail that the mind expects to hear the crash of water rumbling beneath the cry of gulls and the smell of salt tickling the nostrils.

node.name: Library, First Floor
node.description: A book balcony juts overhead from the rosewood paneled walls. Wheeled wooden ladders attached to a brass track lining the top of the bookshelves stand ready to lend height to patrons too short to reach the top of the stacks -- where all the most interesting books hide. A woolen area rug overlays the hardwood floor, muffling scooting chairs as well as footsteps. Oblong study tables and the librarian's desk are centered in the room, beneath a multi-tiered chandelier hanging from the high ceiling.

node.name: Library, Lounge
node.description: The lounge is replete with amenities for patrons taking a break from their reading, or who have just stopped by to chat and socialize. A scattering of leather chairs, low tables topped by lamps radiating a cozy glow through delicate milk-glass globes, and a bar stocked with coffee and lemon water offers refreshment. An ornate marble fireplace mantled in carved rosewood and surmounted by an oval mirror is laid with wood and fragrant cuttings, ready for use should the weather turn cold.

node.name: Library, Balcony
node.description: A rosewood balustrade prevents plunging off the wide balcony and interrupting the studies of the patrons below. Unlike the serious reference works on the first floor, these bookshelves are tight with leather volumes containing fanciful tales of adventure. Oversized armchairs accented with needlework pillows offer cozy retreats to while away an afternoon. A multi-tiered chandelier hanging from the high ceiling hovers just above eye level.

node.name: Perobler's Orlogs, The Vestibule
node.description: A small vestibule lit by ornate bronze lamps occupies the space between an ascending flight of stairs and the street door. All the furnishings, from the polished lamps to the soft carpet underfoot, set a tone of quiet (and expensive) good taste.

node.name: Perobler's Orlogs, The Lobby
node.description: At a large landing at the top of the stairs, several gleaming oak chairs face each other across a dark blue carpet with deep pile. In the far wall, paneled double doors stand open, in limed oak matching the chairs. To the right of the doors is a window with a dark blue drape, and to the left is a smaller door that says Repairs.

node.name: Trintah's Herbal Remedies, Front Salesroom
node.description: Twinkling sounds from a cowrie shell door chime hung above the entrance welcome visitors to this bustling shop. Display shelves lining a large window are packed with an assortment of curious bottles, jars, and boxes containing healing remedies collected from several provinces that have been arranged between a collection of potted plants. Small bundles of exotic herbs hang from the ceiling, thickening the air with their earthy perfume while partially concealing a set of stairs leading to the attic.

node.name: Trintah's Herbal Remedies, Side Salesroom
node.description: Faded whitewashed walls, painted with images of healing regents, serve as advertising for some of the items sold here. An earthy, herbal scent wafts through the air, growing stronger near an iron cauldron hung above a copper brazier, which slowly simmers with one of Trintah's latest experiments. Flashes of color dash around the room like elusive pixies as light from bronze lanterns bounces off strings of colored sea glass, collected from local beaches and hung to create a decorative beaded curtain.

node.name: Trintah's Herbal Remedies, Salon
node.description: Offered by the owner, this cozy salon may be a ploy to keep people spending coins in her shop. The smell of freshly baked bread mingled with medicinal liquors wafts from a sideboard against the wall, masking the odd scent permeating the building while encouraging customers to linger and socialize. Groupings of small tables, covered in colorful linens and surrounded by comfortable chairs, are strategically placed about the room to draw attention to a dolphin triskele mosaic set into the tiled floor.

node.name: Trintah's Herbal Remedies, Behind the Beaded Curtain
node.description: Upon first glance, the curtain leads to a narrow hall that appears to be no more then a well-stocked closet. Rows of shelves line the walls, deceiving the eye, as it opens to a private room. Padded walls covered in red velvet combine with plush carpets to soundproof this area, making it perfect for clandestine meetings. Ornate racks hung behind elegant cases display items not available to the general public. Incense wafts from a round mahogany table, surrounded by chairs, at the center of the room.

node.name: Trintah's Herbal Remedies, Attic
node.description: Ventilation grates provide a slight breeze that assists in drying bundled herbs hung from the rafters but do nothing to relieve the oppressive heat. The air is thick with a strange odor, not floral and not spice but definitely unpleasant. Large storage barrels stacked alongside wooden crates provide seating for the weary. Light from a lantern outside a small window falls on one of these containers, marked with a skull and crossbones, fueling rumors that not all of Trintah's concoctions are for healing.

node.name: Saja's Boarding House, Common Room
node.description: Saja's Common Room is near-continual chaos. A hurried clerk at the back checks travelers in and out while throwing drinks across the counter that serves as both bar and desk. A harried waitress rushes in and out of the kitchen, delivering food to patrons at trestle tables in the main room. A second waitress delivers food through an arch, then delivers coffee to a battered oak booth. Steep twisting stairs at the back lead to the balcony above.

Saja's Common Room is near-continual chaos. A harried clerk at the back checks travelers in and out while throwing drinks across the counter that serves as both bar and desk. A harried waitress rushes in and out of the kitchen, delivering food to patrons at trestle tables in the main room. A second waitress delivers food through an arch, then delivers drinks to a battered oak booth. Steep twisting stairs at the back lead to the balcony above.

node.name: Saja's Boarding House, Dining Room
node.description: The stone wall separating this room from the common room keeps the noise down to a dull roar, making it a preferred location for intimate or discrete conversation over dinner. The oak benches here are smoother than their counterparts in the common room, and the trestle table has a tablecloth. Even so, the real attraction is being at Saja's but out of the common room.

node.name: Saja's Boarding House, Battered Booth
node.description: This battered oak booth is a favorite haunt of bards and students and home to near continuous discussion. The topics tend toward wine, women and song, but even when they're intellectual, they're never less than heated. Be it coffee by day or ale by night, the semi-permanent residents of this booth drink too much. The trestle tables and oaken benches are battered beyond belief, but the history is such Saja would never dare replace them.

node.name: Saja's Boarding House, Common Room Balcony
node.description: Steep, narrow stairs connect the common room to this open landing. Doors to the various rooms in the inn open off the balcony while a sturdy railing prevents inebriated patrons from falling to the common room below.

node.name: Saja's Boarding House, East Hall
node.description: The one relatively quiet place in Saja's, this hallway provides access to the private rooms of Saja's long-term tenants and some of the better funded students. Stout stone walls and smooth oaken floorboards along this hall exhibit little of the spontaneous carving so typical of the more public areas of the inn.

node.name: Saja's Boarding House, Oak Room
node.description: A large feather bed in a battered oak frame dominates a room so small one must almost sit on the bed to close the door.

node.name: Saja's Boarding House, Deobar Room
node.description: Two bunk beds are squeezed into this tiny room, creating space for four students to sleep. A rough chest provides the only storage for clothing. The lack of space compels the residents to spend most of their waking hours in the booth downstairs and only use this room for sleeping.

node.name: Saja's Boarding House, Pine Room
node.description: A heavy oak-framed bed takes up most of this tiny room. A nightstand is the remaining decor of significance. The door latches, though, and the room is dry. The walls are solid and the sheets are clean.

node.name: The Assay Shop, Main Office
node.description: The Assay Office has an exceptionally orderly look to it, as if great care is taken to put, stack, stow or store everything in exactly the right place. An assay clerk with a feather duster in hand stands behind a polished wooden counter bearing three graduated scales.

node.name: Barber Shop
node.description: Metal bars angled like a tiny scaffold, a wrought-iron seat, and a headrest form a chair bolted to the middle of the floor. Vials, brushes, and razors clutter a shelf beneath a wall mirror placed to show patrons the barber's handiwork. An orange cat alternates lounging on the window seat and teasing the parrot perched at the far end of the room. Scattered between beast and bird, a dusting of fur, feathers, seed husks and hair clippings softens the rugged floor.

node.name: Pearl Circle, Pet Shop
node.description: Cracked seed husks are splayed across the floor, and the scent of birdcages and dogs permeates the air. The shop display windows are smudged from wet noses pressing against them from within, while small handprints from without further cloud the panes. A scrappy-looking parrot stares balefully from his perch. Stains on the walls and counters mark the bird's favorite flightpaths. An elderly lady with orange-tinted hair scurries about the shop, while her assistant tends to the counter.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Courthouse Entryway
node.description: Low steps, each the entire width of the room, climb at evenly spaced intervals to the large door at the far end. A long, narrow, black carpet lines the center of the room from one door to the other, hugging the steps closely.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Courthouse Guardroom
node.description: Several long-suffering guards stand on the other side of a large table, arms crossed, frowning and nodding at the supplicants across from them. Occasionally a guard will turn around and pick up an item of some sort and hand it to the person across from him, but more often than not, the people leave empty-handed. The unwilling are forcefully escorted out of the room.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Court of Law and Justice
node.description: High arches in the eight cardinal directions meet in the center to support a large, circular skylight. Behind a curved desk on the far side of the round room sit the judges, stern-looking men and women with a reputation for rapidly deciding the fate of the accused.

node.name: Clerics' Guild, Foyer
node.description: Heavy double doors open onto a large, rectangular foyer. Two stories high, the entryway to the Cleric's Guild is dimly lit by several wall-mounted lanterns. Two thick, fluted pedestals guard each side of the chapel's double door to the east. Low padded benches line each wall between the pedestals and the doorway to the guildmaster's office on the north wall, and the meeting room on the south wall.

Heavy double doors open onto a large, rectangular foyer. Two stories high, the entryway to the Cleric's Guild is well lit through tall, narrow windows high on the walls. Two thick, fluted pedestals guard each side of the chapel's double door to the east. Low padded benches line each wall between the pedestals and the doorway to the guildmaster's office on the north wall, and the meeting room on the south wall.

node.name: Clerics' Guild, Guildmaster's Office
node.description: Neat bookshelves behind a large desk hold Eydtha's private library. The office is brightly lit by a hanging lamp in each corner. A thick, dark blue carpet covers the stone floor, and two padded, straight-backed chairs sit in the corners nearest the door. The large desk holds neatly stacked papers and a small statue of a dolphin.

Neat bookshelves behind a large desk hold Eydtha's private library. The office is brightly lit through two tall windows on the east and west walls. A thick, dark blue carpet covers the stone floor, and two padded, straight-backed chairs sit in the corners nearest the door. The large desk holds neatly stacked papers and a small statue of a dolphin.

node.name: Clerics' Guild, Meeting Room
node.description: The windowless meeting room holds a long, narrow table surrounded by chairs, as well as several smaller tables. Several people sit at a corner table discussing a private matter. Benches line the walls underneath three large tapestries depicting various gods.

node.name: Clerics' Guild, Chapel
node.description: Tall windows high on the north and south walls allow plenty of light into the chapel. A plainly carved altar sits under two beautiful stained-glass windows in the east wall. Thick red carpets hug the walls, leaving the center of the stone floor bare. Each corner holds two floor-standing braziers for the ritual burning of sacred writings.

node.name: Alydendael, Front Gardens
node.description: Thick growths of honeysuckle mingle with clumps of red and blue bellflowers to cover the iron fence and block out much of the noise of the street beyond. Though the plants drape seemingly randomly over the fence, a guiding hand has been at work here. The grass has been trimmed closely along the sides of a gravel path and bands of flowering plants curve alongside all the way to the walls of a sturdy stone building across from an iron gate.

A dark mass of plants clings tenaciously to the iron fence that surrounds the garden. Even at night, the bright colors of flowers stand out against the shadows, obviously tended on a regular basis. A paltry few torches dimly light a gravel path as it angles its way up the sloped surface of a stone building. The flicker of light is brighter on the roof of that building and contrastingly darker where the path runs down to the iron gate that leads to the street.

node.name: Alydendael, Elevated Walkway
node.description: New cornerstones have been mortared into place around the top of a downward arching ramp made of similar new stones. At one point, this walkway was nothing more than a simple roof, now worked over with fresh beams of polished acanth for sturdy footing. A tower pokes up from the far end of the walkway, holding aloft a large bell that peeks out of windows near the top. Below, on either side of the building on which the walkway rests, sit well-tended and thick gardens.

Lines of lit torches flank the sides of the walkway, their glare a bit too bright to make sense of the odd shadows that dance in the gardens below. Perhaps the motion in those gardens is nothing more than an illusion created by the flicker of lights here, but the dark and elegant spire that stretches upwards at the other end of the walkway is hardly false. Only when a torch shimmers just right does the outline of the shade reveal itself to be a bell tower.

node.name: Alydendael, Tower Arch
node.description: Exposed to the elements, the base of the tower is little more than a covered section of the building's rooftop walkway. A sturdy arch stretches over a ramp descending to the back gardens, and an identical one arcs over the walkway itself, but the main support for the tower above are the solid pillars stoically bearing its weight along the northern and western sides. From behind one of the pillars, a tight tendril of ivy wraps its way upwards from the gardens and vanishes from sight.

node.name: Alydendael, Waterfront Gardens
node.description: A carefully manicured gap parts the growths of bellflowers and honeysuckle that drape over the back fence, revealing the lapping waves of the bay beyond the fence's iron bars. A tossed stone would have to travel no further than an arm's distance past the fence before it'd be flying over nothing but the water's surface. The shores of M'Riss from this distance are far out of reach of any tossed thing, however, and can be seen as only a bold tree-lined ridge far away.

The murky waves of the bay splash just beyond an empty space in the plants hanging from the back fence, merely an arm's throw away. Further away is the dark smudge of M'Riss's shore that blocks the horizon, lit only by the tiny twinkling lights of traders moving along the Ring Road. A brighter spark of light flickers into being as a ship on the bay floats past, coming into view as it passes through the gap in the shadowy bellflowers on the fence.

node.name: Alydendael, Belltower
node.description: Rising from the lower floor in a gentle curve along the wall, a set of iron-edged stairs ends just before a small arched window. An ivy vine tapers to an end just beyond the window, growing from some indeterminate place below and clinging to the beige stonework. Crafted from the same stone as the walls, a table rests heavily below the window, safely enough away from the vine therein.

node.name: Alydendael, Oceanview Bell
node.description: A huge bronze bell hangs suspended from a roughly hewn frame in front of the arched windows. Though the bell fills the top of the tower, it fails to block the expansive view of Mer'Kresh and the bay. Far to the northwest, Undogoz Mountain is but a blue mound on the horizon, while much closer, the rooftops of Mer'Kresh lay as would a child's toppled toy blocks. Concentric rings of canals force the building blocks into circles.

node.name: Estate Holders Club, Hallway
node.description: The walls are made of neatly arranged stone blocks. In place of windows, triangular azure and emerald banners dangle from thick acanth rods that criss-cross the ceiling. A few of the banners attempt to hide a section of the western wall where the older stones give way to a recently filled-in arch.

node.name: Estate Holders Club, Lounge
node.description: A white marble statue of a woman carved with flowing robes stretches her arms upwards, coming within a fingerspan's width of the ceiling. Within her hands, she grasps a solitary gaethzen globe that spreads a smooth glow across the room. Crouched in the dim shadow of that statue is a beaten leather couch, built in a gentle curve so that it fits neatly into one of the corners. Before the couch a fluffy bearskin rug sprawls.

node.name: Estate Holders Club, Alydendael Branch Bank
node.description: Definitely cramped and pressed for space, the bank has been left devoid of most adornments. Since a large group of people would fill the room quickly, everything has been designed with speed and efficiency in mind and with few distractions to make customers linger. Still, a great deal of effort has been put into keeping the floors and stone walls spotless.

node.name: Estate Holders Club, Alydendael Branch Exchange
node.description: The exchange booth was once obviously nothing more than a simple storeroom, as is testified above by the exposed undersides of the raw roof beams. From the beams hangs a colorful banner, probably set there to distract customers from spotting clues about the booth's previous use. A recent addition is the set of strong iron bars that cage off the actual booth and the sturdy reinforced door leading therein.

node.name: Perobler's Orlogs, The Showroom
node.description: The light gleams off polished glass in the showroom of Bergen Perobler, Elanthia's foremost chronometrician, where the wares of this inventive and artistic genius are displayed. The buzzes, hums, chirps, cuckoos, chimes, and ticks of his astonishing creations are a background to every conversation. A competent-looking guard by the exit doors keeps a wary eye on the customers and merchandise alike.

node.name: Perobler's Orlogs, The Repair Closet
node.description: This tiny, almost bare room -- the workroom of Knobby Snaggle, Perobler's repairdwarf -- has only a small counter with a high stool behind it. What light there is comes from a small window in the rear wall, on which hang a handsome sign and a framed certificate.

node.name: The Galley Sanegazat
node.description: The galley, like its twin, carries passengers and cargo, but it can easily become a war galley. Brackets for catapults and a reinforced prow for mounting a ram show its military use, part of the reason why the rowers are trained and willing volunteers for this hard service.

node.name: The Galley Cercorim
node.description: Passengers and cargo crowd the deck of the sleek, black galley. Below, visible through the large opening amidships, sit the tanned and muscular rowers, one shift at the oars while the other rests. The exhorter sits in the stern behind his drum, ready to speed or slacken the rhythm as needed.

node.name: Deeper's Tavern, The Common Room
node.description: A few steps lead down to a hot, brightly lit room packed with sailors in every state of consciousness from keen-eyed alertness to drunken collapse. Somewhere in the crowd, a reedy concertina accompanies one or another of several songs being sung in cheery disregard for each other. Behind the mahogany bar, the owner Deeper presides over the tumult, disappearing into the throng from time to time with an armload of mugs. Above the bar hangs a hand-written menu.

node.name: Deeper's Tavern, The Mainmast
node.description: A yard-thick, floor-to-ceiling wooden pillar dominates this corner of the tavern. The mast, as the regular patrons call it, rises like a tree trunk through the center of a circular table. Here the boastful and the optimistic gather to test their strength of arm.

node.name: Deeper's Tavern, Behind the Bar
node.description: Kegs empty and full, mugs for the filling, and the tools of the trade (including a solid-looking bungstarter) line this long, narrow space between the bar and a rear wall hung with trophies of the sea. At the end farthest from the entrance is an open trapdoor.

node.name: Deeper's Tavern, Rancois' Table
node.description: This secluded corner of the tavern contains the favorite table of Rancois Sendaque, the most famous part-time poet in Mer'Kresh. Many of the song scrolls he sells are his original work, and well known among the discriminating (and the stingy).

node.name: Deeper's Tavern, The Cellar
node.description: The dim lantern-light reveals a room filled from the floor to the low ceiling with the supplies and furnishings of the tavern. Here stand broken tables and benches awaiting repair, boxes of crockery mugs, framed paintings that appear to have been used as weapons, and even a stuffed marlin that has seen better days. Stacked kegs of rum hide one wall completely, and a large wine rack filled with bottles stands a little ways out from another wall. Stairs lead up to the tavern's main room.

node.name: Mer'Kresh Town Hall, Grand Foyer
node.description: A multitude of torches illuminates the high arch of the Grand Foyer, light glinting from stained glass windows in the ceiling. White marble columns anchor the majestic arch to the grey marble floor. Great oaken doors along the north wall lead to government offices and the formally lit Council Arch leads south to the Grand Hall.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Grand Hall of the Council
node.description: The Grand Hall of the Council is extremely formal. If the Rissan oak beams and white marble walls could speak, they would tell tales about the founding of Rissan tradition. A huge oak council table dominates the hall. Council chairs surround the table at precise locations. The council president's chair looms like a throne above one end of the council table, adding to the sense of awe the room inspires.

node.name: Housing Arcade, New Homes Office
node.description: At the far end of a spacious room with a polished oak floor sits a large, ornately carved desk and a high-backed oak chair with a velvet cushion. On either side behind the desk are floor-to-ceiling stained glass windows. A brightly colored rug is draped over the desk.

node.name: Housing Arcade, Transfer Office
node.description: This little room, barely bigger than a closet, is crowded even more by crates, boxes, racks, and bookcases overflowing with scrolls and papers. In front of a tiny window is a folding desk and stool.

node.name: Mer'Kresh Town Hall, Debts and Fees
node.description: A massive oak counter topped with a fence of steel bars dominates the Mer'Kresh Office of Debts and Fees. A smiling clerk behind the counter does his cheerful best to help Rissans who have problems with debts or with the city bureaucracy.

node.name: Mer'Kresh City Hall, Office of Citizens
node.description: Several candles cast a warm glow on the polished rosewood counter spanning the back third of the room. An elderly clerk stands behind the counter, ready to serve people seeking citizenship. Plainly framed documents interspersed with banners and flags hang from the walls, and historical mementos are housed in a case near the entrance. A large bronze plaque is affixed to the wall near the case. Amid the mishmash of artifacts, and perhaps an artifact himself, sits an old man whittling.

node.name: Caress-of-the-Moons Manor, Rooftop Garden
node.description: Stone troughs along the edges of the rooftop serve a dual purpose as homes for flowering plants and as guard rails to keep sky-watching mages from stumbling off into the gardens two stories below. Spider vines arc over the ledges and flow downward, unafraid of the height. To the west, the roof of the commodities building stares into the sky in poor imitation of the scholars that use this manor.

node.name: Caress-of-the-Moons Manor, Rooftop Garden
node.description: Heavy growths of plants and vines drape down the side of the building, wrapping themselves lovingly around the stone gargoyle statues protruding from the ledges. A blank spot some distance below hints that one of the gargoyles may have lost its mortared hold on the wall and plummeted into the canal. Poking out over the edge of the rooftop, and uncaring of the canal's rushing waters, is a polished blackwood telescope set neatly onto a raised pedestal at the southern end of the roof.

node.name: Caress-of-the-Moons Manor, Upper Hall
node.description: Dark wood paneling runs the length of the upper hall, split by contrasting trim nearly halfway up the wall. A carved sandalwood door breaks the monotony of the paneling along the southern wall. Tacked to the center of the door is a curled note, pierced through the middle by a bent nail. At the far end of the hall, a spiral staircase rises through a covered opening in the roof, while opposite, a set of wide steps descends to the lower floor.

node.name: Caress-of-the-Moons Manor, Hall
node.description: An unusual copper and bronze sculpture consisting of crescent moon shapes bobs silently at the base of some wide steps. Surrounding the metal moons on all sides, the walls are covered with a painted depiction of Moon Mages in various stages of stargazing. The three moons -- Xibar, Katamba and Yavash -- smile down upon the watching mages from their locations high in the painted sky.

node.name: Caress-of-the-Moons Manor, Foyer
node.description: Directly opposite from an ironwood door is a massive portrait of a hunting expedition, though this is far from the only indication of the manor owner's inclinations. The walls are decorated with an inordinate number of trophies, ranging from snowbeast heads to bearskins and leucro tails. A snarling boar's head stares down the hall from its perch high above the glazed marble floors.

node.name: Carillon, Garden Shrine
node.description: Two simple altars, one of rosewood and the other of stone, nestle within the stand of close-set mimosa. Fluttering slowly to the ground, feathery blossoms settle to the earth like a carpet of pink snow. Overhead, soft murmurs whisper through the leaves, perhaps the counsel of the gods, perhaps the entreaties of the dead. Dull basalt stepping stones lead out of the grove.

node.name: Mer'Kresh Ovens
node.description: The warm aroma of baking invites adventurers into this tidy shop. Fresh bread is displayed on a counter next to a table full of tarts. A sturdy stair squeezed into one corner shares the back wall with a great stone oven. The baker and her helpers scuttle about behind the counter, mixing batter, kneading bread, tending the oven, and generally scattering flour everywhere.

The warm aroma of baking invites adventurers into this tidy shop. Freshly baked bread is displayed on a counter next to a table full of tarts. A great stone oven along the back wall dwarfs a sturdy stair squeezed into one corner. The night crew is busy behind the counter, mixing batter, kneading bread, tending the oven, and preparing bread for tomorrow's Mer'Kresh.

node.name: Mer'Kresh Ovens, Apartments
node.description: The rich aroma of baking bread drifts along the hall from the bakery below followed by an occasional dusting of flour. Warmth radiates from a huge stone chimney next to some stairs on the back wall. The plain oak floor and sturdy oak walls suggest solid, but unspectacular apartments.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Gull Circle
node.description: Marbled granite boulders have been used to create a retaining wall that shores up the land along one side of the road. Stones once carefully stacked by size and secured with mortar form a solid mass that should stand the test of time despite its rundown appearance. Along the top, wires running between wooden fence pickets have been added to discourage the local children from exploring.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Gull Circle
node.description: Weatherworn pallets of flagstone sit waiting for workers to return and lay them out as pavement on the sections of unfinished road. Weeds grow in scraggly patches around the stacked stone, managing to spread despite the hardened soil. Broken and discarded masonry tools litter the area, suggesting it has been some time since a cleanup crew has been by.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Gull Circle
node.description: In preparation for paving with flagstones and mortar, this section of the road's gravel base has been covered with a bed of sand carted in from the island's shoreline. Having been left too long, the once packed and graded surface is now covered in uneven ruts. A collection of rakes has been tossed into a haphazard pile that passing seagulls have liberally decorated with excrement as they've flown by.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Gull Circle
node.description: The trail of gravel runs alongside the waterway then swerves off towards a section of open land. Rolling waves can be heard slapping at the footings of the Nelyn Bridge located a short distance away, filling the air with the salty scent of the water in the nearby canal.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Gull Circle
node.description: Veering off, this section of road still needs a lot of work. The flagstones stop abruptly as the land drops down into a shallow path, dug to create a route through the ashen soil.
