Chunky gravel lines the ditch's base and is topped by another layer of rocks the size of peas in an attempt to provide good drainage under the flat stone surface when it is completed in the future.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Gull Circle
node.description: Crunching underfoot, the hard-packed soil is covered in chunks of broken mortar and its dusty residue, carpeting the land in construction debris. A broken-down wooden wagon stands tilted at an angle, its cargo of granite blocks slowly shifting to one side of the bed as time goes by. Several planks, piled haphazardly nearby, are starting to show signs of rot from the island weather combined with the occasional damp mist that travels over from the canal.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Gull Circle
node.description: Surviving despite the poor soil conditions, a tall oak was left standing to provide some shade from summer's heat to the otherwise stark lot. A makeshift bench, built from a stack of black basalt slabs, sits close to the tree's gnarled trunk. Judging by the trash left scattered around, workers took full advantage of the slight comfort offered to eat and watch the entertaining scenery of gondolas gliding by in the canal or fishermen struggling with their catch at the water's edge.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Gull Circle
node.description: Granite markers subdivide this large lot into smaller sections, mapping out a strip of plots suited in size for future shops. The ground limestone once used to connect them has now mostly worn away, leaving only a slight shadow on the hard, ashen soil to show the builder's original intentions. In one corner, a black basalt foundation remains unfinished, waiting for mortar to secure the back wall in place.

node.name: Fang Cove, Fate's Fortune Lane
node.description: A towering marble archway opens a gap in the wall to the north and separates the ongoing construction and somewhat more refined completed structures of Fate's Fortune Lane from the crude structures and makeshift walkway along the beach. The entrance to a squat, wide bungalow sits in opposition to the arch, and the sheltering cliffs of Fang's Peak rise up from behind it. To either side of the arch, cobblestones of different shapes and sizes have been laid out to form the wide Fate's Fortune Lane.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Undogoz Square
node.description: Cobblestones line this small square, which is dominated by the large, stone building housing the Mer'Kresh Crafting Society. A parade of sturdy wagons going in and out of the nearby alley is a common sight as artisans haul their hand-made goods off for sale at the local markets. Wooden benches line the edge of the canal, offering a scenic spot for workers to rest and enjoy some fresh air.

node.name: Lanternside Inn, Front Desk
node.description: A long desk enhanced with pieces of shell and driftwood rests in front of a series of shelves lined along the back wall. Timidly, envelopes and scrolls poke out from their current homes upon the shelves, awaiting delivery to some employee or resting traveler. A small bell dangles above the desk, patient for a tap from the next person to check into the inn, while a hutch fastened with a bronze padlock waits calmly to dole out room keys.

node.name: Lanternside Inn, Lobby
node.description: Two twin windows, shuttered on the outside, stare inwards towards a brightly upholstered couch and a small wooden end-table. Across from the end-table, the wall is set with a brass sign made in the shape of a dancing herb leaf. The mutterings of conversation and clinking of dinnerware spill out from the sign's neighbor, an artistically carved arch.

node.name: Lanternside Inn, Hallway
node.description: The smooth painted walls leading to the lobby stop at the chair rail, giving way to a textured surface of plaster. Small bits of shell and coral stuck in the plaster turn the upper walls into a mosaic of pink and beige spirals ascending a set of carpeted stairs. Other than a couple of brass candelabras to light the hall, there are no adornments to distract any of the inn's tired customers from a direct course upwards and to a comfortable bedroom.

node.name: Lanternside Inn, Upper Floor
node.description: An out-of-place tapestry barely covers several gaps where time and vandalistic wayfarers have removed bits of attractive coral from their resting places set in the walls. A richly colored carpet runs through the hallway and down the stairs to the lobby below.

node.name: Lanternside Inn, Canal Room
node.description: Curtains, the color of a blue and green streaked river, almost hide a picture window with a view of the outdoor dining area of the Herb Play. A driftwood bedstand sits quietly by the bed, pushed snugly against the chair rail that splits the walls. The lower half of the walls are painted in pastel shades of green, while the upper is a soft creme not unlike the color of a frothy stream churning up sand. Only a small rug covers any of the hardwood floor, nestled at the foot of the bed.

node.name: Lanternside Inn, Upper Floor
node.description: Small bits of coral and seashell peek out from the plaster of the walls, mixed in during the construction of the inn. Lightweight tapestries have been arranged intermittently down the hall, showing various scenes of a musical performance. A narrow vase rests in its own bed, a small linen-covered table pushed tightly against the wall and out of the way of yawning wanderers stumbling towards their rooms.

node.name: Lanternside Inn, Upper Floor
node.description: A portrait framed in dark wood and lit by a small piece of gaethzen hangs on the rough plaster wall. The shells and coral that poke from the plaster along the other sections of the inn are not absent here, and form intricate spiral patterns around the edges of the portrait. A small brass plaque is embedded below.

node.name: Lanternside Inn, Volcano Room
node.description: A plush red carpet covers the entire floor, thick and wooly but for one triangular shaped spot near the red-painted door worn thin from the door's use. A matching set of fiery curtains hangs about the window, brushing just against the obsidian-topped bedstand. A bright orange bedspread lays on the bed, continuing the theme of fiery color. Even the tropical plant in the corner shares the theme, if in design rather than color, as it rests in a stone pot filled with ashy dirt.

node.name: Lanternside Inn, Island Room
node.description: A large bed carved realistically in the shape of a giant seashell dominates the center of the room. Its wood has been painted in shades of pearlescent pink and white, and a pale blue bedspread drapes over the edge of the bed. A deep blue curtain hangs around the window, and a nightstand decorated with bits of coral squeezes itself between it and the bed.

node.name: Oceanhome Apartments, Mer'Kresh
node.description: Most of the floor has been swept free of debris, revealing a mosaic of faded pastel tiles. Black dirt, spared by the broom, still clings in the corners of the room. Hung crookedly on one wall, a message board wears an assortment of smudged papers proclaiming long-past resident meetings.

node.name: Oceanhome Apartments, First Floor
node.description: A set of rickety stairs ascends to the next floor as the giant-sized face of a smiling Rissan beams down the hall. Originally painted in extreme colors, the face is now partly veiled by a thin layer of soot and dust. Tightly clutching to a foaming mug with one hand, the happy Rissan indicates his prized drink with a pointing finger.

node.name: Oceanhome Apartments, Second Floor
node.description: Holes pockmark the walls, some the size of a fist, while others are no larger than a finger. Bits of plaster and wood lie on the floor, roughly corresponding to the locations of the gaps. On the ceiling, brown-edged water stains mock celestial bodies, their origins not nearly as mysterious or impressive.

node.name: Oceanhome Apartments, Second Floor
node.description: A lonely red door sits at the end of the hall, the floorboards just before it swept clean by some industrious soul. Nearby, an open window reveals a sight of Gull Circle, though not by design -- the window is missing several of its glass panes.

node.name: Ristmuir's Armory, Showroom
node.description: Ristmuir's tidy establishment is a study of craftsmanship, from the riste racks cleverly built into the window casement to the fine detailing of the showroom's wide-planked floor. An array of weapons covers the back wall, arranged by their decorative appeal in an attempt to lure shoppers into making a purchase. In the corner, a tall bin holds a selection of ammunition for sale.

Ristmuir's tidy establishment is a study of craftsmanship, from the riste racks cleverly built into the window casement to the fine detailing of the showroom's wide-planked floor. Lanterns illuminate the array of weapons covering the back wall to draw the attention of evening shoppers. In the corner, a tall bin holds a selection of ammunition for sale.

node.name: Mer'Kresh Crafting Society, Vestibule
node.description: The building is constructed of stone, mined locally, to withstand years of abuse from the salty air that blows in off the ocean. Tall, fluted columns stand near each corner of the room, helping to support the raised dome ceiling decoratively covered in silver leaf. Tiny lights hidden within the roof's architecture reflect off the metallic surface to highlight an intricate, mosaic map of M'Riss inlaid into the tile floor. A pair of crossed hammers adorns the top of an archway leading to the Forging Society.

node.name: Mer'Kresh Forging Society, Entry Hall
node.description: Across the room from an archway leading to the main edifice are a pair of wooden benches, which are the only furniture provided for the customer's comfort. Periodically, custodians hired to keep the area tidy wander through, occasionally muttering as they sweep the stone floor clean of all the grime people drag in with them when they leave the foundry. On one wall, an artist has painted a portrait of the Undogoz Forge as a memorial to the now closed building where many Rissans learned their craft. Insulating the space from the searing heat of the smithy is a heavy oak door, covered on each side with a sheet of steel for added protection.

node.name: Mer'Kresh Forging Society, Bookstore
node.description: A long, cypress counter serves as a partition between the bookstore and a much smaller office area, making it easy for Master Smith Kapric, who runs the facility, to keep an eye on customers when they enter and offer assistance when necessary. Tall racks are filled with sample books for the shopper who prefers to peruse the merchandise.

node.name: Mer'Kresh Forging Society, Supply Shop
node.description: Crude, wooden pallets stacked with recently mined ore create cramped aisles throughout the room, giving customers a chance to inspect the selection before making their purchase. Off in the corner, several crates contain additional materials for sale, including already smelted ingots.

node.name: Mer'Kresh Forging Society, Tool Shop
node.description: Despite the building's thick, rock walls, the faint sound of metal hitting metal can sometimes be heard, its repetitive pattern becoming almost lyrical. Clerks keep busy checking to make sure the displays of tools and supplies for sale are filled, often rushing to the backroom to load up on any stock that is missing.

node.name: Mer'Kresh Forging Society, Maker's Mark Shop
node.description: White paint coating the stone block walls serves as a neutral canvas for the sketches of sample designs aimed at helping potential customers decide on what aspects they desire in their maker's marks. Tools, templates and patterns hang above a small work area where artisans construct the purchased orders promptly as they come in. Heat emanates from cracks around a leather curtain leading to the foundry.

node.name: Mer'Kresh Forging Society, Foundry
node.description: Along the top of one wall, a row of exhaust vents siphon off some of the oppressive heat generated by the fire in an attempt to make the room's temperature more comfortable for forgers busy at their craft. An ingot cutter salvaged from the Undogoz Forge sits near a large pile of fuel and a leather curtain leads to the Maker's Mark shop.

node.name: Mer'Kresh Forging Society, Foundry
node.description: Already dark by its nature, the stone walls of the forge are blackened further by soot, ash and dust kicked up by the constant stream of workmen the forge serves on a daily basis. Custodians hired by the city wander in and out checking the large waste bucket, making sure the discarded pieces of metal are cleaned up off the floor and keeping the foundry as clean of trash as possible.

node.name: Mer'Kresh Forging Society, Foundry
node.description: Emanating from the fire, patchy clouds of soot cover the ceiling and form streaks down the walls like black rain during a tropical storm. Ashy dust fills the air, spiraling up in the heat as it blows off a pile of fuel. A rhythmic hammering sound drifts over from the smithy to the west, followed by an occasional curse indicating things probably didn't go the way the forger desired.

node.name: Mer'Kresh Forging Society, Foundry
node.description: A combination of sweat and molten steel intertwine to permeate the air with a slightly acrid, sour smell that varies in intensity depending on the time of day. Suspended by heavy chains secured to a blackened wooden beam is a huge granite crucible. Piled high in the corner of the room is a large pile of crushed coal, waiting for the next forger to feed it to the fire.

node.name: Mer'Kresh Forging Society, Foundry
node.description: Once servicing the Undogoz Forge, select pieces of equipment, which still remain in good working condition, have found a new home here as part of the city's attempts to keep costs down. In the room's center, a constant fire burns in the circular firepit with a small pile of fuel by its side, waiting to be added to increase the flames to a blazing inferno. The clang of metal against metal drifts over from the smithy to the west and a heavy, oak door leads to the entry hall of the society.

node.name: Mer'Kresh Forging Society, Smithy
node.description: The back wall of the smithy area is covered with a grimy grey and red dust from the constant attention of the grindstone. Several small windows along the top of the wall vent some of the choking dust and heat from the forge, but solid steel grates prevent anything larger than a gauntlet from passing through and into the canal beyond.

node.name: Mer'Kresh Forging Society, Smithy
node.description: Despite being swept on a regular basis by diligent custodians, metal shavings and bits of broken steel litter the floor, creating a sparkling effect when lit by the flames of the forge's roaring fire. The smell of burning coal and heated metal fight for dominance here, indicating the amount of work this room normally sees.

node.name: Mer'Kresh Forging Society, Smithy
node.description: An oversized, glowing forge dominates the center of the stone floor, banishing all other equipment to the outlying corners of the room. Nicknamed -- The Beast -- it's constantly consuming the red-hot coals in its belly and demanding more fuel from the pile, much like a ravenous animal. From the smell of burning flesh lingering in the room, many craftsmen have felt its fiery bite.

node.name: Mer'Kresh Forging Society, Smithy
node.description: The floor bears the burns and scars from regular sprays of stray sparks. Should only the stone surface be an ocean, the equipment scattered about would make a parody of an armada of ships, possibly in mockery of the failed attempts of the Dragon Priest Empire to subdue Mer'Kresh. In reality, though, the only subduing going on is that of iron and steel beneath a determined worker's tools.

node.name: Mer'Kresh Forging Society, Smithy
node.description: Constant waves of scalding heat flow through the smithy, set into motion by the sizzling fires and red-hot metals being worked. Even sounds seem warped and muffled, but somehow the echo of clanging tools and crackling of fiery sparks manage to cut through the thick air. Nothing is spared the attentions of the temperature and dust, and both stone and metal tools wear the scars that the environment has delivered.

node.name: Carillon Park, Footbridge
node.description: Rising gently, the footbridge's arched shape is barely noticeable as it spans the narrow brook. Spilling from the bridge's railing, roses and honeysuckle trail into the water and are tugged by the current. Within the brook, glints of golden fish flash among the plants and sparkling coins thrown from the bridge by wishers and seekers. The path away from the carillon parts the tufts of grass and cattails vying for space on the stream bank.

node.name: Carillon Park, Stone Lions
node.description: Sheltered beneath a camphor tree, a proud basalt lion watches over his stone pride as they lounge in the flower-speckled clearing. One lioness rolls on her back, one sniffs at a clump of lilies, while yet another sculptured lioness licks her cub. Several stone cubs gather around a bronze paladin seated upon a basalt slab. At the north end of the clearing, a grass and bamboo gate closes the path from further exploration.

node.name: Perpetual Blossoms of Mer'Kresh, Salesroom
node.note: Perpetual Blossoms of Mer'Kresh|Blossoms of Mer'Kresh|florist
node.description: Perpetual Blossoms is like an endless spring in Mer'Kresh. Flowers bloom all about the room, and a gablefruit vine climbs across the walls, flourishing in the illumination of a skylight set in the ceiling above. Large displays, including those in the front window, hold freshly cut blossoms and bouquets that fill the air with intoxicating scents. Floral clerks discretely watch over the domain, gently tending flowers and customers alike with gracious smiles.

node.name: Mer'Kresh, Carousel Family Services
node.description: A series of guarded arches line the southern wall. The complicated framework of iron and timbers spans across the ceiling. Countless gears, pulleys and weights form the strikingly complex mechanism which drives the Carousel.

node.name: The Sweet Life Candy Shoppe, Salesroom
node.description: White paint covers the room from floor to ceiling, providing a blank canvas for the decorative exhibits of candy placed throughout the shop. Strategically placed near the front window, a glass case filled with colorful, novelty candies works as free advertising to lure in customers from the street. A long counter displaying an abundance of gourmet chocolates fills the space along one wall and across from it a table holds containers for sale so shoppers can make their own gifts for friends.

node.name: The Sweet Life Candy Shoppe, Salesroom
node.description: Recessed into the ceiling, a collection of gaethzen orbs bounce light off the whitewashed walls to help keep this interior space bright during business hours. Placed against one wall, a long counter displays an array of colorful confections created with the shop's adult clientele in mind. Across the room, a strong scent of liquor wafts into the air from the neatly stacked chocolates waiting to be purchased on the glass case. Tucked into the corner is a table filled with containers shoppers can buy so they can pack up their sweets to take home for family and friends.

node.name: The Herb Play Restaurant, Host's Station
node.description: A brilliantly colored wooden partition angles from the host's stand towards the opposite wall, blocking the majority of the restaurant beyond from view, and the host's station from the view of seated patrons. Likewise, any diners glancing towards the exit are spared the sight of the host turning away unsavory types, and are only met by the gazes of the myriad of colored masks affixed to the decorative screen.

node.name: The Herb Play Restaurant, Dining Room
node.description: Gaethzen spheres hang behind green shades, lending a soft glow that still reflects in the highly buffed and polished hardwood floors. The only tables are those small enough to be carried by waiters, and remain in place only long enough for food to be transferred to an awaiting booth. Screens of wood and paper create private dining areas for those artists too smug to allow others a watchful eye of their affairs.

node.name: The Herb Play Restaurant, Dining Room
node.description: Beautiful etched-glass doors twinkle as the outside deck's torches dance in the night air. Gaethzen orbs, dangling from delicate chains above, glow with steady illumination, vanquishing the darkness just enough to reveal diner's plates. The scent of food and smoke drifts from the kitchen, visible as wispy grey threads around the lighted orbs.

node.name: The Singer's Booth, Herb Play Restaurant
node.description: A horseshoe shaped seat curves around the dining table, obviously packed full of fluffy down given the odd feather that pokes out. Along the sides of the seat, musical instruments of all types have been carved into the wood and rubbed with oil to a high sheen. Someone has painted a cryptic signature with gold-colored paint on a small black shield etched with concentric circles that hangs overlooking the tabletop.

node.name: The Actor's Booth, Herb Play Restaurant
node.description: Several miniature portraits line the walls and screens around the booth. Representing theater performers of some by-gone era, it's likely that most of the faces portrayed have found a stage on the Starry Path by now. In contrast to the faded color of the portraits, bright purples and yellows streak the walls, and even the seat of the booth itself has been dyed in vivid shades.

node.name: The Dreamer's Booth, Herb Play Restaurant
node.description: A bold deobar carving of Hodierna perches over the booth, arms outstretched and a sly smile spread across her face. White alfar statuettes descend from her embrace, pierced by metal rods that hold them in place in the vignette. To enhance the drama, the depiction of a clear night sky slowly dissolving into a sunrise has been painted in grand colors. A few wavy letters mark the signature of the artist right near the side of the table.
